ui

Class TabbedOutputPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JTabbedPane
            • ui.TabbedOutputPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, SolutionReadyListener

    public class TabbedOutputPanel
extends javax.swing.JTabbedPane
implements SolutionReadyListener
    A TabbedOutputPanel contains the various graph panels for a specific ODE tab. It also includes the Data panel, which displays a table of the internal data points calculated. TabbedOutputPanel receives points from the solver and calls the draw method on each graph. Individual graphs can also request information such as variable lists or points. When a new ODE is entered, replaceODE or overlayODE must be called to indicate the proper graphing behavior. Currently an overlay is performed in the case of identical variable lists. Contrary to its name, TabbedOutputPanel does not extend the OutputPanel class.
    Version:
    July 2013
    Author:
    Aaron Becker, modified by Max Comstock
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createGraphPanels

        public void createGraphPanels()
        Creates panels for displaying the ode solution data. Currently it creates a component graph for each dependent variable, a phase plot for the first two variables defined, a multi-graph which can plot any number of variables against a given variable, and a data table. Eventually a 3D graph will be added. If the new ODE has the same number of variables as the previous ODE, the bounds of each graph will be preserved, although new GraphPanels will still be created.
